title: Did Trump Admin Remove CDC as Overseer of COVID-19 Hospital Data?
subtitle: In what was framed as an effort to streamline the reporting process, the federal government ordered hospitals to send patient information to a centralized database operated by HHS.
author: Jessica Lee
vclaim: In July 2020, U.S. President Donald Trump's administration established new guidelines for hospitals to report COVID-19 patient information that eliminates the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) as the leader of data collection.
